page.title: 05Activities in Balmullo.
page.content: People of primary school age have a youth club once a week during the winter months in the village hall. This is also the meeting-place for Brownies, Cubs, Guides and Majorettes. Boys who join the Scouts go to Leuchars or Cupar. Quite a few pupils go to Dundee or Cupar for swimming and several go to Newport to a gymnastics club. The rest of our free time is used to help with jobs about the house, playing with friends, watching T.V., using computers, tending pets, playing in the park, enjoying music and reading. Some of the older pupils like golf. We are given lessons after school by Mr. A.S. Eggo who lives in the village. Sometimes the golfers go to St. Andrews for a round of golf. Many boys attend football training, hoping for a place in the Balmullo Hearts Team.
